content:
# EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Plate Production Line
Consists of two furnaces for smelting copper:
- Furnace 1 at position(0.0, 0.0) - processing copper ore with coal fuel
- Furnace 2 at position(2.0, 0.0) - processing copper ore with coal fuel

### Iron Plate Production Line
Consists of:
- Furnace 3 at position(4.0, 4.0) - processing iron ore with coal fuel

### Electronic Circuit Production Line
Located around position(9.5, 11.5), consists of:
- Input chest at position(6.5, 11.5) containing iron plates
- Burner inserter at position(7.5, 11.5) moving items from input chest
- Assembling machine at position(9.5, 11.5) crafting electronic circuits
- Output burner inserter at position(11.5, 11.5)
- Output chest at position(12.5, 11.5) storing finished products

### Power Generation System
Located around position(-7.0, 24.5), consists of:
- Offshore pump at position(-9.5, 24.5) providing water
- Pipe network connecting water flow
- Boiler at position(-7.0, 24.5) converting water to steam
- Steam engine at position(-2.5, 24.5) generating electricity
- Electric pole network distributing power

### Research Lab System
Located around position(0.5, 28.5), consists of:
- Lab conducting research
- Input burner inserter at position(0.5, 30.5)
- Storage chest at position(0.5, 31.5) containing science packs

# ERROR TIPS

### Research Technology Errors
- Check prerequisites before attempting to research a technology
- Verify if technology is already researched before attempting to research it again
- Common prerequisites missing:
  - Logistics needed for Logistics 2
  - Chemical science pack needed for Advanced Material Processing 2
  - Optics needed for Solar Energy

### Crafting Errors
- Ensure sufficient raw materials are available before attempting large batch crafts
- When crafting fails partially, the error shows how many items were successfully crafted vs failed

### Entity Placement
- Check if target position is clear before placing entities
- Verify all required connections (electricity, fluid) are available when placing new structures
